Uses of Class
org.gradoop.examples.AbstractRunner

  • Packages that use AbstractRunner 
    Package Description
    org.gradoop.benchmark.grouping
    Contains example Gradoop programs that can be executed on a Flink cluster.
    org.gradoop.benchmark.patternmatching
    Contains benchmark programs related to pattern matching.
    org.gradoop.examples
    Contains example Gradoop programs that can be executed on a Flink cluster.
    org.gradoop.examples.biiig
    Examples related to the BIIIG approach.
    org.gradoop.examples.dimspan
    Classes to use DIMSpan frequent subgraph mining standalone, i.e., not within Gradoop programs.
    org.gradoop.examples.grouping
    Program to run parametrized Grouping on extended property graphs.
    org.gradoop.examples.io
    Examples that show how to use Gradoop DataSource and DataSink classes.
    org.gradoop.examples.patternmatching
    Programs to run simulation algorithms on extended property graphs.
    org.gradoop.examples.sna
    Benchmarking programs tailored to run on Graphalytics social network datasets.
    org.gradoop.utils.sampling
    Contains utility programs to sample graphs
    org.gradoop.utils.statistics
    Contains example programs to compute graph statistics.

    • Uses of AbstractRunner in org.gradoop.examples.grouping

      Subclasses of AbstractRunner in org.gradoop.examples.grouping 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Communities
      Demo program that uses GellyLabelPropagation to compute communities in a social network and groups the vertices by their community identifier.
      class  Composition
      Demo program that combines the grouping operator with (1) the subgraph operator extract vertices and edges by specified predicate functions and (2) the transformation operator to modify vertex properties which are used for grouping
      class  GroupingRunner
      A dedicated program for parametrized graph grouping.
      class  Schema
      Demo program that uses graph grouping to extract the schema from a (possibly large) property (logical) graph.

    • Uses of AbstractRunner in org.gradoop.examples.io

      Subclasses of AbstractRunner in org.gradoop.examples.io 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DOTExample
      Example program that reads a graph from an EPGM-specific JSON representation into a GraphCollection and stores the resulting GraphCollection as DOT.
      class  JSONExample
      Example program that reads a graph from an EPGM-specific JSON representation into a GraphCollection, does some computation and stores the resulting LogicalGraph as JSON.

    • Uses of AbstractRunner in org.gradoop.examples.patternmatching

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  PatternMatchingRunner
      This program can be used to run the different pattern matching engines implemented in Gradoop.

    • Uses of AbstractRunner in org.gradoop.examples.sna

      Subclasses of AbstractRunner in org.gradoop.examples.sna 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  SNABenchmark1
      The benchmark program executes the following workflow: 1) Extract subgraph with: - vertex predicate: must be of type 'Person' - edge predicate: must be of type 'knows' 2) Group the subgraph using the vertex attributes 'city' and 'gender' and - count the number of vertices represented by each super vertex - count the number of edges represented by each super edge 3) Aggregate the grouped graph: - add the total vertex count as new graph property - add the total edge count as new graph property
      class  SNABenchmark2
      The program executes the following workflow: 1) Extract subgraph with: - vertex predicate: must be of type 'Person' - edge predicate: must be of type 'knows' 2) Transform vertices and edges to necessary information 3) Compute communities using Gelly label propagation 4) Compute vertex count per community 5) Select communities with a vertex count greater than a given threshold 6) Combine the remaining graphs to a single graph 7) Group the graph using the vertex attributes 'city' and 'gender' and - count the number of vertices represented by each super vertex - count the number of edges represented by each super edge 8) Aggregate the grouped graph: - add the total vertex count as new graph property - add the total edge count as new graph property The program can be either executed using external data (for benchmarking) or demo data (SNABenchmark2.main(String[])).

    • Uses of AbstractRunner in org.gradoop.utils.sampling

      Subclasses of AbstractRunner in org.gradoop.utils.sampling 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  RandomNodeSamplingRunner
      Runs RandomNodeSampling for a given graph and writes the sampled output.

      Computes DistinctTargetIds for a given logical graph.

      Computes DistinctEdgePropertiesByLabel for a given logical graph.
      class  DistinctVertexPropertiesRunner
      Computes DistinctVertexProperties for a given logical graph.

      Computes EdgeCount for a given logical graph.
      class  EdgeLabelDistributionRunner
      Computes EdgeLabelDistribution for a given logical graph.

      Computes SourceLabelAndEdgeLabelDistribution for a given logical graph.
      class  StatisticsRunner
      Computes all statistics for a given logical graph.

      Computes TargetLabelAndEdgeLabelDistribution for a given logical graph.
      class  VertexCountRunner
      Computes VertexCount for a given logical graph.

      Computes VertexDegreeDistribution for a given logical graph.

      class  VertexLabelDistributionRunner

      class  VertexOutgoingDegreeDistributionRunner
      Computes OutgoingVertexDegreeDistribution for a given logical graph.
